result.execSummary:
The defendant Marvette L McDowell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.  Court authorizes transfer to county jail convenient to employment or residence.

miscConds.notes: Bond amount posted shall be applied.  If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall have no contact with the co-defendant, Diamond A.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with recommendations.  

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marvette L McDowell

records.addlTxt: Def in person & by Atty Jeffrey A Jaeger.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  State moves to amend to Misd. Bail Jumping-946.49(1)(a), Court grants amendment.    Guilty plea entered to amended charge.  Court finds def guilty on amended charge and enters judgment.

Def in person & by Atty Jeffrey A Jaeger.  Atty Sandra J Giernoth appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  (Waukesha Co. 14CF325)  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.  Arraignment scheduled for June 24, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Def in person & by Atty Nadya Perez Reyes State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Mark D Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Court continues the cash bond.  SPD will represent.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 21, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Def in person in custody & by Atty Barbara Privat for State Public Defender.  Atty Peter Cannon appeared for State.  Clk: CP. Bail/Bond hearing. Def has pending Waukesha Co cases (14CF325 & 14CM676).
